titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Records of the Hudson-Fulton Celebration Commission
1905-1913 (Bulk 1909-1911)
MS 314
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Lara Chmela

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-10-18T12:07-0400

did.abstract: The Records of the Hudson-Fulton Celebration Commission focus on the commission's role in orchestrating the Hudson-Fulton Celebration of 1909. The collection contains correspondence, contracts, vouchers, cancelled checks, financial and legal documents, meeting minutes, clippings, and ephemera.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Permission to quote from this collection in a publication must be requested and granted in writing. Send permission requests, citing the name of the collection from which you wish to quote, to
Manuscripts Curator
The New-York Historical Society
170 Central Park West
New York, NY 10024

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as Hudson-Fulton Celebration Commission Records, The New-York Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Hudson-Fulton Celebration was held September 25 - October 11, 1909 to commemorate the 300th anniversary of Henry Hudson discovering the Hudson River in 1609 and the 100th anniversary of the first commercial steamboat service, started by Robert Fulton in 1607. Communities along the River observed the celebration, with events occurring from Staten Island to Cohoes, New York.

In 1905, George B. McClellan, Mayor of New York City, and Francis W. Higgins, Governor of New York, appointed a committee of approximately 150 citizens to plan and implement a Hudson tercentennial celebration. The Mayor also formed a committee to plan a celebration honoring Fulton's contributions to the Hudson River region. In 1906, it was decided to merge the two committees and through the enactment of Chapter 325 of the Laws of 1906, the Hudson-Fulton Celebration Commission was formed on April 27, 1906.

The commission was divided into several working committees, the number increasing from 12 in the first year to 51 by the time the celebration commenced. Some of these committees were the Aquatic Sports Committee, Auditing Committee, Historical and Carnival Parades Committee, Invitations Committee, Medal Committee, Naval Parade Committee, Plan and Scope Committee, Reception Committee, and Religious Services Committee.

The New York State government appropriated about 48 percent of the funds required for the celebration, while the New York City government contributed about 24 percent of the funds. Since the federal government did not provide financial aid for the celebration, nor did any other state governments, the remaining 28 percent of required funds came from private donations made to a subscription fund set up by the commission.

The celebration was intended to not only commemorate two significant historical achievements, but also encourage "civic pride," start a "historical awakening," "assimilate" the immigrant population, and promote "international friendship" and world peace. Dignitaries from throughout the world were invited to participate, and visitors filled New York hotels beyond capacity. The celebration included banquets and receptions, various parades throughout the city, aquatic competitions, and naval parades among other festivities. Wilbur Wright was hired to perform several aerial demonstrations during the celebration, flying along the Hudson River from Governor's Island to Grant's Tomb. Upon its conclusion, the Hudson-Fulton Celebration was described as a "jubilee of happiness," whereby New York enjoyed two weeks of peace, patriotism, and prosperity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Hudson-Fulton Celebration Commission Records document the activities of the Commission from 1905 to 1913. The bulk of the material is from 1909 to 1911, the time in which most of the preparation and follow-up activities occurred. While the Invitation Replies subseries, as well as a few pieces of correspondence, do discuss the event's success, most of the collection focuses on preparation activites and the Commission's inner workings, rather than the celebration itself. However, The Fourth Annual Report of the Hudson Fulton Celebration Commission offer a detailed account of the Celebration, as well as insight on the event's successes.

The bulk of the collection is composed of correspondence and financial documents, particularly payment vouchers. The collection also contains legal documents, organizational materials, clippings, ephemera, and assorted materials unrelated to the Hudson-Fulton Celebration. There is very little visual material, as most of this is housed in the Print Room's collection (see Related Material).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are divided into 12 series:

list.item: Series VII: The Fourth Annual Report of the Hudson Fulton Celebration Commission
Series VIII: Materials unrelated to the Hudson-Fulton Celebration

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material at The New-York Historical Society
relatedmaterial.p: The Fourth Annual Report of the Hudson Fulton Celebration Commission, 1909 (BobCat call number: F127.H82 H53 1910)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains both the internal and external correspondence of the Commission. While most of the correspondence is arranged alphabetically by sender, letters written by the Commission's secretary, Henry Sackett, and assistant secretary, Edward Hagaman Hall, are filed alphabetically by recipient. This series also contains memoranda sent to members of the Commission.

did.unittitle: Correspondence from Assistant Secretary and Secretary with no specified recipient

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains letters written by individuals and companies pledging to donate a specified amount of money to the Celebration's subscription fund.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of replies to the various events sponsored by the Commission, as well as thank you letters commending the Commission on a job well done. Most of the individuals invited to the Celebration and banquets were dignitaries and officials from the United States, as well as countries throughout the world.

did.unittitle: Acceptances for Metropolitan Opera House banquet
Thank you letters: Foreign countries, A-M
Thank you letters: Foreign countries, A-M
Thank you letters: United States (includes letter from President Taft)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains acknowledgements sent to the Commission confirming receipt of The Fourth Annual Report of the Hudson Fulton Celebration Commission.

did.unittitle: Acknowledgements confirming receipt of The Fourth Annual Report of the Hudson Fulton Celebration Commission, 1909
Acknowledgements confirming receipt of The Fourth Annual Report of the Hudson Fulton Celebration Commission, 1910

Acknowledgements confirming receipt of The Fourth Annual Report of the Hudson Fulton Celebration Commission, 1916

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of cancelled checks written by the Commission to individuals and organizations. Once again, the funding source is noted by the folder title. This suberies also contains checkbook registers for the various fund accounts. The checks are arranged by check number.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains all other financial documents related to the operation of the Commission, such as account sheets, ledgers, cashbooks, payroll records, and audit reports.

did.unittitle: Bills and receipts: American District Telegraph Company
Audit report for the period of 1905 Dec. 5-1912 Jun. 30

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the financial documents, such as account sheets, for specific committees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The vouchers in this subseries document the financial transactions between the Commission and other individuals and companies. The funding source for the various vouchers is noted by the folder title. In addition, this subseries contains schedules for the various vouchers, which act as indexes for the series. The documents are arranged by voucher number.

did.unittitle: Chapter 325 of the Laws of 1906, Schedule
Chapter 325 of the Laws of 1906, A11, A12
Chapter 466 of the Laws of 1908, Schedule
Chapter 448 of the Laws of 1909, Schedule
Chapter 448 of the Laws of 1909, Unnumbered
Chapter 513 of the Laws of 1910, Schedule

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The legal documents in this collection consist of materials related to complaints against the Commission, as well as paperwork related to copyrighted materials (i.e. Celebration emblem, etc).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains contracts and agreements between the Commission and various other parties, such as bands, architects, and vendors. In some instances, relevant correspondence and documents are filed with the contracts. The contracts are arranged alphabetically by the name of the second party.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of materials related to the operation of the Commission, such as meeting minutes and stated procedures, as well as logistical materials related to the Celebration.

did.unittitle: Minutes: Annual Meeting of the Hudson Fulton Celebration Commission
Minutes: Committee on Badges, Flag, and Poster
Minutes: Joint Committee on Half Moon and Clermont
Order of Business for Trustees' Meeting

Minutes: Executive Committee, Trustees' Meetings, Upper-Hudson Committee assistant secretary's copy)

Official documents: Chapter 325 of the Laws of 1906, Chapter 217 of the Laws of 1908, By-laws, Member list, Minutes
Official documents (includes copies of letters, calendar of events, guest list, and meeting minutes)

Mrs. Spencer Trask's Lyrics to "America" (sung by Glee Club)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The ephemera in this collection consists of invitations, programs, tickets, and various other printed materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains magazine and newspaper clippings about the Celebration.

did.unittitle: Series VII: The Fourth Annual Report of the Hudson Fulton Celebration Commission

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains various drafts for The Fourth Annual Report of the Hudson Fulton Celebration Commission, 1909, many of which contain editing notes.

did.unittitle: The Fourth Annual Report of the Hudson Fulton Celebration Commission, volume 1
The Fourth Annual Report of the Hudson Fulton Celebration Commission, volume 2
Series VIII: Materials unrelated to the Hudson-Fulton Celebration

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of miscellaneous materials related to the collection, such as visiting cards collected at the various events, materials relating to Robert Fulton, obituaries of Commission members, and loose envelopes from the collection.

did.unittitle: List of members of the Board of Alderman
